contest-event.event-date: Oct. 9, 1971 D National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Le Roi d'Ys Royal Albert Hall, Kensington, Kensington and Chelsea, Greater London, England, UK The Insignia of Honour was awarded to James Shepherd. The Spotlight on Service was given to Wiliam Scholes. A Baton of Honour was presented to the winning conductor.
